newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's Malan won't attend World Economic Forum.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's Malan won't attend World Economic Forum.

text.p: Brazilian Finance Minister Pedro Malan will not attend this week's World Economic Forum in the Swiss city of Davos because of a heavy workload, an aide said.

The aide said Malan's decision not to go had nothing to do with current moves to have a bill allowing presidential re-election passed by Congress. The voting was due to begin Tuesday in the lower house.

"The minister is not attending the World Economic Forum because he has a lot to do here," the aide said, adding that Malan would be travelling with President Fernando Henrique Cardoso to Britain and Italy between February 9-14.
This year's annual Davos forum takes place from January 30 to February 4.
